author: AAP
title: Reynolds claims Bathurst 1000 pole
text:
Reynolds claims Bathurst 1000 pole   7:52   Reynolds claims Bathurst 1000 pole 
Controversial Ford driver David Reynolds has claimed pole position for Sunday’s Bathurst 1000 at a wet Mount Panorama. 
Reynolds enjoyed the better of shocking conditions on Saturday to clock two minutes, 27.82 seconds and emerge fastest in the top-10 shootout. 
Kiwi Scott McLaughlin was second fastest (2:28.97) ahead of veteran Jason Bright (2:29.70). 
Reynolds earlier in the week was fined $25,000 by V8 Supercars for making an offensive remark towards an all-female team at the Bathurst 1000. 
It was the first wet shootout – which decides the Great Race’s top 10 grid spots – held since 2000. Stay up to date with the latest sports news Follow our social accounts to get exclusive content and all the latest sporting news!
